titles.title: GAS PRICE Act
GAS PRICE Act
Give Americans Stability at Pumps as Rising Inflation Causes Emergencies Act

A bill to require the Energy Information Administration to submit to Congress and make publicly available an annual report on Federal agency policies and regulations and Executive orders that have increased or may increase energy prices in the United States, and for other purposes.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

bill.summary:
Give Americans Stability at Pumps as Rising Inflation Causes Emergencies Act or the GAS PRICE Act
This bill requires the Energy Information Administration (EIA) to report on any policy, regulation, or executive order with an effective date of January 20, 2021, or later that the EIA determines has increased or may increase energy prices in the United States.
